questions.question: At what stage is the ovum released from the ovary?

The nuclear membrane of the sperm head disappears once it is inside the ovum.

options: Fertilization of a mature ovum (23X) by a mature sperm (23X)
Fertilization of a mature ovum (23X) by a mature sperm (23Y)
The formation of the inner cell mass

questions.question: What is the primary function of the trophoblast?
options: It is the layer that undergoes implantation.
It pushes the zygote towards the uterus.

questions.question: How is the zygote primarily transported towards the uterine cavity?
options: By the movement of cilia and peristalsis of the fallopian tube
By the flow of uterine milk

questions.question: When is the implantation process typically completed?
options: By the end of the 4th day after fertilization
By the end of the 7th day after fertilization
By the 10th or 11th day after fertilization

questions.question: What is the source of nourishment for the ovum during the 3 days before implantation in the uterine cavity?

In the roof of the yolk sac

questions.question: What is one of the protective functions of the endometrium?
options: It produces hormones to sustain pregnancy.
It forms a mucopolysaccharide barrier against trophoblast penetration.
It contracts to push the embryo into the uterus.
It differentiates into the three germ layers.

questions.question: Which two cavities appear in the inner cell mass after implantation?

The mesoderm develops in the roof of the yolk sac.

options: Destroying the hyaluronic acid of the egg cell

questions.question: Which of the following parts contains the centrioles?

options: It allows the sperm to enter the egg
It gives energy to the sperm, allowing it to swim
It helps the sperm to swim fast enough

questions.question: Which membrane is secreted by the egg itself in mammals?

options: Ampullary portion of the Fallopian Tube

options: The shell of a hen's egg

options: They help the ascent of sperm by increasing motility and peristalsis
